entry.title: The Buttered Cat Paradox
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 113,523Chapters: 37/?Kudos: 1,385

Summary: “No comment.”“You don’t know what I was going to ask,” Clark said with a hint of a smile. “Maybe I just wanted to congratulate you on catching the Film Freak.”Bruce gave him a flat look.“Or maybe I think I can help.”“With a case of vandalism?”Clark stepped in front of him. “It’s not vandalism and you know it, detective.”“And what makes you say that?”“If it were vandalism it would be something a lot more juvenile. To the point. It wouldn’t claim there were seventeen missing kids. That’s public outcry.”“Is that so?”“That and I tried to do a story on the growing number of homeless children last month and I got shut down. According to the last count, the numbers have been decreasing, but there’s been no change in policies, no extra funding to CPS, or shelters, or even an increase in the number of inmates in the juvenile detention center. So where are they going?” Detective Bruce Wayne may have the highest solve rate in Gotham, but if he wants to solve this case, he’ll need the help of an elusive street kid, and while Dick Grayson always lands on his feet, he usually lands himself right into trouble.

entry.title: You can take the boy from the circus
entry.summary:
Author: Gotham_Blight

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 29,924Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 170

Summary: Damian Al-Ghul Wayne had everything at one point. He was a prince. Ibn al Xu'ffasch. Son of the bat. Heir to the demon. He had never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his palace in Nanda Parbat. He had never asked to be shipped to a gloomy, grey city. Even when his father kept taking in orphans and ruining his plans for inheritance, Damian stood steadfast. But then his father died, leaving behind his newest orphan. A tiny acrobat with watery blue eyes and black curls, who spoke no English. Damian knew the boy never asked to be ripped away from everything that he knew, from the warmth of his home, his culture, his circus troupe. Damian knew he needed to be there for him.

entry.title: Pseudo-Diegetic Narrative
entry.summary:
Author: writersagainstwritersblock

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,259Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 211

Summary: Looking down, Bruce found a little boy staring up at him with big blue eyes. Rain weighed down his dark hair and dripped onto the shoulders of his unbuttoned yellow rain jacket, the t-shirt underneath quickly becoming soaked. On his feet were the smallest pair of green galoshes Bruce had ever seen. “Batman,” the boy said with wonder, clutching at the edge of his cape. “You’re really Batman.” “…I am.” The little boy held up his hands in the universal gesture for up. Glancing around, Bruce expected to find an adult not far behind, but he couldn’t see any parent-shaped figures nearby as actors ducked under umbrellas, camera crew reset their equipment, and PAs scrambled around the makeshift set. “Up,” the boy said, stretching up onto his tiptoes. Bruce picked him up. “I don’t see them,” the boy pouted. “I thought since you’re so tall I would see them from up here.” “Your parents?” “I was ‘posed to stay put, but I didn’t, and there’s a lot, a lot of tall people here.” “Mm.” “I know you are very busy fighting the bad guys,” the boy said seriously. “But you help people too, right?” “Yes.” Bruce’s chest tightened. “We’ll find them."
